      • run

        public void run()
        A menu with 6 options 1. Appointments 2. Owners 3. Pets 4. Save 5. Load 6. Help Takes input from mainMenu()

      • help

        public void help()
        Prints out help

      • owners

        public void owners()
        Switch with options to 1. Add owner 2.List owner pets 3. List owners 4. Owner Options 5. Return

      • appointments

        public void appointments()
        Switch with options to 1. Add appointment 2. Resolve appointment 3. List appointments 4. Return

      • petOptions

        public void petOptions()
        Prints out the options 1. Create Appointment for Pet 2. Show Pet Info 3. Add Pet Info 4. Show Pet List 5. Add Pet 6. Resolve Appointment 7. Return Uses a switch to activate the chosen option

        Loads the program from a data file named by the user.

      • menu

        public int menu(int option)
        Parameters:
        option - There are 2 different options to print out. One for owner and one for appointment. The one selected will determine which ones are printed out.
        Returns:
        The option that is chosen for either appointments or owner option menu.

      • ownerOptions

        public void ownerOptions()
        Owner options are printed and then a switch is used from the input

        Parameters:

      • chooseOwner

        public Owner chooseOwner()
        Prompts the user to enter a user ID and changes currentOwner to the owner that is chosen. Catches the IndexOutOfBoundsException.
        Returns:
        The owner that is chosen

      • createAppointment

        public Appointment createAppointment()
        Prompts the user to create an appointment for a new animal or an existing one. Used in appointments().
        Returns:
        The appointment that is created

      • createAppointment

        public Appointment createAppointment(Animal p)
        Prompts the user to create an appointment for an existing pet. Used in petOptions()
        Parameters:
        p - A pet that will have an appointment added to it
        Returns:
        The appointment that is created.

      • enterDate

        public java.lang.String enterDate()
        Makes sure the user inputs an 8 character string. Recommends to use YYYYMMDD format for best sorting possible.
        Returns:
        A string that represents the date.
